To set up one or more fields to be ''unique'' there are a few steps to take. If you want to configure multiple uniques or unique with combines the steps are repeated for each field you want to configure. 
There is however a small difference in the last step if you wish to set up a combine, but it is covered below in its own example.

The first thing you want to do is to create collectStorageTerm for the field you want to be unique.
!***> collectStorageTerm
{{{
{
    "name": "collectStorageTerm",
    "children": [
        {
            "name": "recordInfo",
            "children": [
                {
                    "name": "id",
                    "value": "exampleTextVarStorageTerm"
                },
                {
                    "name": "validationType",
                    "children": [
                        {
                            "name": "linkedRecordType",
                            "value": "validationType"
                        },
                        {
                            "name": "linkedRecordId",
                            "value": "collectStorageTerm"
                        }
                    ]
                },
                {
                    "name": "dataDivider",
                    "children": [
                        {
                            "name": "linkedRecordType",
                            "value": "system"
                        },
                        {
                            "name": "linkedRecordId",
                            "value": "cora"
                        }
                    ]
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "name": "extraData",
            "children": [
                {
                    "name": "storageKey",
                    "value": "exampleTextVar"
                }
            ]
        }
    ],
    "attributes": {
        "type": "storage"
    }
}
}}}
*!
This storageTerm then needs to be added to a field you wish to be set up as unique.
!***> storageTerm added to a child reference
{{{
...
    {
        "name": "childReference",
        "repeatId": "1",
        "children": [
            {
                "name": "repeatMin",
                "value": "0"
            },
            {
                "name": "repeatMax",
                "value": "20"
            },
            {
                "name": "ref",
                "children": [
                    {
                        "name": "linkedRecordType",
                        "value": "metadata"
                    },
                    {
                        "name": "linkedRecordId",
                        "value": "exampleMetadataTextVar"
                    }
                ]
            },
            {
                "name": "childRefCollectTerm",
                "children": [
                    {
                        "name": "linkedRecordType",
                        "value": "collectTerm"
                    },
                    {
                        "name": "linkedRecordId",
                        "value": "exampleTextVarStorageTerm"
                    }
                ],
                "attributes": {
                    "type": "storage"
                }
            }
        ]
    }
...
}}}
*!
Finally the storageTerm needs to be added to the postType it's intended to be used on.
!***> storageTerm added as a unique
{{{
{
    "name": "recordType",
    "children": [
        {
            "name": "recordInfo",
            "children": [
                {
                    "name": "id",
                    "value": "exampleRecordType"
                }
                ...
            ]
        },
        ...
        {
            "name": "unique",
            "repeatId": "1",
            "children": [
                {
                    "name": "uniqueTerm",
                    "children": [
                        {
                            "name": "linkedRecordType",
                            "value": "collectTerm"
                        },
                        {
                            "name": "linkedRecordId",
                            "value": "exampleTextVarStorageTerm"
                        }
                    ]
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}
}}}
*!
'''Note for combine''': This last step is slightly different if you want to add this as a combine for a unique. You need to add it as a combineTerm to a field where you already added a uniqueTerm.
!***> adding a combineTerm to the field where you have added a uniqueTerm
{{{
{
    "name": "recordType",
    "children": [
        {
            "name": "recordInfo",
            "children": [
                {
                    "name": "id",
                    "value": "exampleRecordType"
                }
                ...
            ]
        },
        ...
        {
            "name": "unique",
            "repeatId": "1",
            "children": [
                {
                    "name": "uniqueTerm",
                    "children": [
                        {
                            "name": "linkedRecordType",
                            "value": "collectTerm"
                        },
                        {
                            "name": "linkedRecordId",
                            "value": "exampleTextVarStorageTerm"
                        }
                    ]
                },
                {
                    "name": "combineTerm",
                    "repeatId": "0",
                    "children": [
                        {
                            "name": "linkedRecordType",
                            "value": "collectTerm"
                        },
                        {
                            "name": "linkedRecordId",
                            "value": "exampleNumberVarStorageTerm"
                        }
                    ]
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}
}}}
*!
